All the participants provided written informed consent under a protocol that was approved by the Ethics Committee of Shanghai Jiao Tong University Affiliated Sixth People’s Hospital (YS-2016-048). The microarray data were derived from GEO database ( GSE19429 ROBO1 z ROBO1 z ROBO1 z ROBO1 Mice Conditional Robo1 Robo1 f/f Robo1 Robo1 Robo1 f/f Robo1 f/f Cre + Robo1 f/f Cre − Mx1-Cre Robo1 Robo1 f/f Cre + Robo1 f/f Cre − Cell lines and cell culture 32D cells (murine HSPC cell line) were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium with 10% FBS and murine IL-3 (10 ng/ml). Murine primary BM cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium with 10% FBS, murine CSF (100 ng/ml), murine IL-3 (10 ng/ml), and murine IL-6 (10 ng/ml). Construction of retroviruses and lentiviruses The Cdc42 Nck1 Nck1 Flow cytometry HSPCs BM cells were first stained in PBS with 1% FCS at room temperature (RT) for 15 min with BD antibody (Ter119, B220, Gr1, CD11b, CD3, CD4, CD5, CD8, and CD127), as well as Streptavidin APC-cy7, Sca-1 BV510, c-Kit PE-cy7, CD150 PE, CD48 FITC, CD34 AF647, Flt3 PE, and CD16/32 PE at 4°C for 30 min. The antibodies for flow cytometry are listed in table S2. Myeloid and erythroid differentiation PB, BM, and spleen cells were stained in PBS at 4°C for 30 min with myeloid differentiation markers (Mac-1 APC and Gr-1 PE) or erythroid differentiation markers (Ter119 APC, CD71 PE). The antibodies for flow cytometry are listed in table S2. Cell cycle assay BM cells were first stained in PBS with 1% FCS at RT for 15 min with BD antibody (Ter119, B220, Gr1, CD11b, CD3, CD4, CD5, CD8, and CD127), as well as HSPCs surface markers and ki67 APC and 7AAD at 4°C for 30 min. The antibodies for flow cytometry are listed in table S2. Apoptosis analysis BM cells were firstly stained with erythroid differentiation markers (Ter119 APC and CD71 PE) and then stained in 1× binding buffer at RT for 15 min with apoptosis markers (annexin V FITC). The antibodies for flow cytometry are listed in table S2. CFU assay A total of 1 × 10 3 2 5 2 Co-immunoprecipitation assay For the endogenous immunoprecipitation (IP) assay, murine BMNCs and 32D cells were lysed with T/G lysis buffer [20 mM tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 300 mM NaCl, 50 mM NaF, 2 mM EDTA, 1% Triton X-100, and 20% glycerol] on ice for 40 min; then, the supernatant was incubated by adding primary antibody overnight at 4°C. The Protein A/G beads were added the next day at 4°C. The beads were washed three times and collected for subsequent immunoblotting tests. Quantitative PCR Total RNA was extracted with Trizol (Invitrogen, 15596018) and then reversely transcribed using PrimeScript RT reagent Kit (TaKaRa, RR047A). SYBR (Vazyme, Q511-03) was used in qPCR. The qPCR primers are listed in table S1. Western blot analysis The cells were lysed with a 1× Laemmlie buffer. The cell lysates were separated by SDS–polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis and transferred onto the polyvinyl difluoride membrane. The membranes were then blocked with 5% nonfat milk for 1 hour at RT and incubated sequentially with primary antibodies overnight at 4°C. The membrane was washed three times and incubated with secondary antibodies for 1 hour at RT. The antibodies are listed in table S2.
